slides.mascot_explanation: You totally rocked this! You went through the entire scientific process, from asking a question to sharing your discoveries, just like a real scientist. This means you are a scientist, and that's something to be super proud of!

parent_notes: The science fair presentation is a major confidence-builder. Be an enthusiastic audience and ask genuine questions. If possible, invite extended family to attend. Document the presentation with photos and video. Celebrate the completion regardless of results — the process is the point. If your child says their experiment 'failed' because the hypothesis was not supported, reframe it: they discovered something unexpected, which is how real science works. Save the presentation board or photographs for the portfolio.

title: End-of-Year Show — Performing and Celebrating Creative Achievement
description: Students host their end-of-year art exhibition and musical performance for family and friends. They present their artwork, perform their concert repertoire, and celebrate a year of creative growth with their community.
instructions:
1. Set up the art exhibition space with all selected pieces and labels.
2. Arrange the musical performance area.
3. Welcome guests and hand out programs.
4. Begin with the art exhibition: walk visitors through the display, sharing artist's statements.
5. Answer questions about individual artworks.
6. Transition to the musical performance.
7. Perform the complete concert program.
8. Accept applause and acknowledge the audience.
9. Mingle with guests who want to discuss the artwork.
10. Take photographs and celebrate the achievement.

slides.heading: End-of-Year Show
slides.mascot_explanation: This first slide is like the title page for our big event, the End-of-Year Show! It’s telling us that this is a special time to show off all the cool art and music we've been working on and celebrate how much we've grown this year. Think of it like the opening credits of your favorite movie, setting the stage for something awesome.

slides.setup_instructions: Complete the exhibition setup. Test the performance space. Have programs ready to hand out. Set up refreshments if planned. Place the guest book at the entrance.
slides.mascot_explanation: Okay, this slide is our "shopping list" for the show. We've got our artwork, our instruments, programs to give guests, a camera to take pictures, and a guest book for people to sign. We need all these things to make sure our exhibition looks great, sounds amazing, and we can remember everyone who came to support us. Go grab everything on the list with a grown-up!

slides.text: This is your moment. You have planned, created, rehearsed, and prepared. Now you share it all. Welcome your guests warmly and be proud of what you are showing them — it represents a year of hard work and creative growth.
slides.mascot_explanation: This is all about you! You've worked super hard all year, creating art and practicing music, and now it's your time to shine. The most important thing right now is to greet everyone who comes with a big smile and make them feel welcome. Remember, you should be really proud of everything you're about to share.

slides.text: Walk your guests through the art exhibition. Share the story behind your favorite pieces. Read your artist's statements. Let visitors linger — art is meant to be experienced, not rushed through.
slides.mascot_explanation: Now it's time to be a tour guide for your art! As your guests walk around, point out your favorite pieces and tell them the story behind them – like why you chose those colors or what inspired you. Reading your artist's statements is like giving them the secret key to understanding your amazing creations.

slides.text: For the musical performance: take a deep breath, focus on the music, and play from the heart. If something goes wrong, keep going. The audience came to support you, not to judge you. Enjoy the experience.
slides.mascot_explanation: It's showtime for the music! Just take a big breath, try to relax, and really focus on the notes and rhythm. Don't worry if you make a tiny mistake, everyone makes them, and the audience is here to cheer you on no matter what. The most important thing is to have fun and really feel the music as you play.

slides.text: After the show, talk with your guests. Accept compliments graciously — a simple 'Thank you, I worked hard on that' is perfect. This is your celebration. Soak it in.
slides.mascot_explanation: After the performance, people will want to tell you how great you were! When they give you compliments, just smile and say "thank you," maybe mention that you worked hard on it. This is your celebration, so enjoy all the praise and feel good about sharing your talents.

slides.prompt: Host the complete end-of-year show: (1) Welcome guests and distribute programs. (2) Guide visitors through the art exhibition, sharing stories and artist's statements. (3) Perform the complete musical program. (4) Mingle with guests and discuss your work. (5) Have someone take photographs of you with your artwork and during performance.
slides.mascot_explanation: This is where we put it all together – the actual show! You'll greet everyone and give them a program, then lead them through the art part, sharing your stories. After that, you'll perform your music, and then you'll get to chat with people about your awesome work. Don't forget to have someone snap some photos of you during all this!

slides.text: Tonight you shared your creative spirit with the people who matter most to you. Every piece of art, every note of music represented growth, courage, and self-expression. This is what Montessori education is about: developing the whole person — mind, heart, and creative spirit.
slides.mastery_check: Can the student present their artwork confidently, perform their musical repertoire successfully, interact graciously with guests, and celebrate their creative achievements?
slides.mascot_explanation: You did it! Tonight you showed everyone your creativity and how much you've learned and grown. Every painting, drawing, and song you shared was a piece of you, showing your courage and how you express yourself. This whole experience is what learning is all about – using your mind, your heart, and your amazing creative spirit.

parent_notes: This is a highlight of the year — treat it as a genuine event. Dress up a little, invite people who care about your child, and create a special atmosphere. The guest book is a wonderful touch that your child will treasure. Take plenty of photos and video. After the event, have a private conversation celebrating your child's growth and courage. This experience builds confidence that extends far beyond art and music into every area of life.
